ì‚¬ì‹¤ ì˜¬í•´ ìš´ì˜íŒ€ ë¦¬ë“œë¥¼ ë§¡ë˜ ë•Œ, ì£¼ì „ë‹˜ì´ ì™œ ë¦¬ë“œë¥¼ ë§¡ê² ë‹¤ê³  í•œ ê²ƒì¸ì§€ ì œê²Œ ë¬¼ì–´ë³¸ ì ì´ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ê·¸ë•Œ ë­ë¼ê³  ë‹µí–ˆëŠ”ì§€ ì œëŒ€ë¡œ ê¸°ì–µì€ ì•ˆë‚˜ëŠ”ë°, â€˜ëŠ¥ë ¥ì€ ì—†ì§€ë§Œ ê¶Œë ¥ìš•ì€ ìˆì–´ì„œ í•˜ê³  ì‹¶ë‹¤ê³  í–ˆë‹¤â€™ ì´ëŸ° ë§¥ë½ìœ¼ë¡œ ì–˜ê¸°í–ˆë˜ ê²ƒ ê°™ì•„ìš”. ê·¸ ì´í›„ì— ë˜ ì €í•œí…Œ ë¬¼ì–´ë³¸ ê±´ í”¼ì–´ íšŒì¥ í•  ìƒê°ì´ ìˆëŠëƒì˜€ì–´ìš”. ê±°ê¸°ì„œ ì €ëŠ” ë­ë¼ê³  ë‹µí–ˆëƒë©´ â€˜ì†”ì§íˆ ê´€ì‹¬ ìˆë‹¤. ê·¼ë°, ì €ëŠ” ë¹„ì „ì´ ì—†ë‹¤. ëŒ€ì‹  í˜„ìƒ ìœ ì§€ëŠ” í•  ìì‹ ì´ ìˆë‹¤. ê·¸ë˜ì„œ ë§Œì•½ ë¹„ì „ ìˆê³  ëŠ¥ë ¥ ìˆëŠ” ì‚¬ëŒì´ ìˆë‹¤ë©´ ê·¸ ì‚¬ëŒì´ ë§¡ì•„ì•¼ í•œë‹¤â€™ë¼ê³  ëŒ€ë‹µí–ˆë˜ ê¸°ì–µì´ ë‚˜ìš”.

item.title: a short review of the fourth week
item.description: This weekâ€™s goal Listen to html5 & css3 lectures Transelate image in gatsby official tutorial part 0 ~ 2 Start writing post about â€˜How toâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
This weekâ€™s goal

  • Listen to html5 & css3 lectures
  • Transelate image in gatsby official tutorial part 0 ~ 2
  • Start writing post about â€˜How to start a gatsby blog with gatsby starter beeâ€™.
  • Find â€˜share on Facebookâ€™ component

Listening to html5 & css3 lectures

I have planned toÂ learn Javascript basics, but to learn Javascript, it required some background knowledge of html5 & css3. So I started listening to html5 & css3 lectures. The lecture I have chosen was basics of them.

I have learned about tags and comments. My goal for next week is to complete the lecture course.

Translate image in gatsby official tutorial part.0~2

I have done it, â€˜cause I promised with Haryu to translate images at the last study meeting. I decided that only one was needed to be translated, and I translated only that.

Like this.

Itâ€™s embarrassing to show my work to others, but I did my best.

Start writing post about â€˜How to start a gatsby blog with gatsby starter beeâ€™.

I will write a post about how to start a gatsby blog with gatsby starter bee. I have thought about how to write it.

Iâ€™ll show it after I uploading the post.

Find â€˜share on Facebookâ€™ component

In this theme, the â€˜share on Facebookâ€™ button doesnâ€™t work. So I must fix it.

Before fixing it, I should know how the function works. I have found some codes , but I could not understand how it works. I think I must learn React first.

Whatâ€™s changed on the blog.

  1. Changed copyright below the blog, Jbee to hyna.
before after
  1. Added Twitter account to my blog.

item.title: a short review of the third week
item.description: This weekâ€™s goal add a workflow script start studying React add comments feature in the blog translate Gatsby Official Tutorial Partâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
This weekâ€™s goal

  • add a workflow script
  • start studying React
  • add comments feature in the blog
  • translate Gatsby Official Tutorial Part 3

Adding a workflow script

Thanks to Hyojekim, I finally added a working workflow script to my repository. The reason why it didnâ€™t work on my GitHub pages was because of the branch name. Yes, the branch name was the main reason.

I recreated the repository and pushed it to branch main. And it did work!

You can find the workflow script onÂ my GitHub page.

Start studying React

React: A code library (built with JavaScript) for building user interfaces. Itâ€™s the framework that Gatsby uses to build pages and structure content.

- from. Gatsby Official Tutorial Part: 0(here)

Iâ€™ve started studying React onÂ 42seoul.groom.io. But as you see from above, itâ€™s a code library built with JavaScript. So I decided to learn Javascript basics.

Adding comment feature on the blog

The initial restoring repo of blog comments is the theme creatorâ€™s repo. So, I had to update the gatsby-meta-config.js file. I changed the repo in gatsby-meta-config.js file and deployed it. And then, BOOM! All of the comments were gone, like this.

I was in a panic. Iâ€™ve tried everything, but the comment didnâ€™t come back. The next day, I was going to start from the beginning. Before deleting the repository of my blog, I compared the gatsby-meta-config.js file from others. And found out the difference.

//wrong one
comment: {
	disqusShortName: '', // Your disqus-short-name. check disqus.com.
	utterances: 'SaltySalt77/blog_comments.git', // Your repository for archive comment
}
//right one
comment: {
	disqusShortName: '', // Your disqus-short-name. check disqus.com.
	utterances: 'SaltySalt77/blog_comments', // Your repository for archive comment
}

Did you find it? Yes, I had to add the repository name, not the link of the repository. After correcting the code, the comments feature came back. Like this.

Translating Gatsby Official Tutorial Part 3

As you know, Iâ€™m Korean, so I participated in translating Gatsby Official Tutorial. While translating, I learned about how to install and use plugins.

You can find Gatsby Official Tutorial Part 3 in here.

item.title: a short review of the second week
item.description: This weekâ€™s goal write a workflow for auto-deploying -> changed to write a shell script for auto-deploying. study markdown syntax analyzeâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
This weekâ€™s goal

  • write a workflow for auto-deploying -> changed to write a shell script for auto-deploying.
  • study markdown syntax
  • analyze blog features

Writing a workflow for auto-deploying

~ Monday

Iâ€™ve tried many of them which came up while searching. But errors occurred while installing npm(npm install). So I changed the way for auto-deploying. I wrote a shell script! And this is it.

#!/bin/bash
git add .
git commit -m "$(date)"
git push origin master
npm run deploy
git checkout gh-pages
git pull origin gh-pages
git add .
git commit -m "$(date)"
git push origin gh-pages
git checkout master
npm install

It pushes source codes to branch master with commit message(date) and pushes deployed files to branch gh-pages.

Tuesday

I peeped in Hyojekim_space and saw nodejs version occurred errors. So I simply added code of setting nodejs version in a workflow. And it did work!
It worked but it pushed the deployed files not on branch gh-pages, on master. So I went to Github pages, read readme files, and found that it pushes the deployed files on branch master in default.

Changed profile images and site tab images.

Iâ€™ve changed profile images and site tab images.
These images are found in the content/assets directory.

file name before after
profile.png
felog.png

Thank you.

item.title: a short review of the first week
item.description: I am writing the post in English because I canâ€™t write Korean in my development environment. If I want to write in Korean, I guess I have toâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
I am writing the post in English because I canâ€™t write Korean in my development environment. If I want to write in Korean, I guess I have to write on GitHub. (Or make my development environment can write Korean.)

It was so hard to deploy the blog. I made a blog about 6times and deleted the blog about 5times. Iâ€™ve done that because when I deployed and went to the blog, I could just see 404 error pages. I could not confix it. So I started over.

My next goal is to make an auto-deploying workflow. And add new stuff to my blog. (ex. category page)

Thank you!

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Getting Started ğŸ˜ 1. Create a Gatsby site. If you are not using , following Gatsby Getting Started 2. Start developing. 3. Add your contentâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Getting Started ğŸ˜

1. Create a Gatsby site.

# create a new Gatsby site using the blog starter
$ npx gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

If you are not using npx, following Gatsby Getting Started

$ npm install -g gatsby-cli
$ gatsby new my-blog-starter https://github.com/JaeYeopHan/gatsby-starter-bee

2. Start developing.

$ cd my-blog-starter/
$ npm start
# open localhost:8000

3. Add your content

You can writeâ€¦

  • contents to blog in content/blog directory.
  • resume content/__about directory.

With markdown syntax and some meta data

Support script for creating new post

$ npm run post

4. Fix meta data

You can fix meta data of blog in /gatsby-meta-config.js file.

5. Publish with netlify

ğŸ’¡ if you want to deploy github pages, add following script to package.json

"scripts": {
    "deploy": "gatsby build && gh-pages -d public -b master -r 'git@github.com:${your github id}/${github page name}.github.io.git'"
}

:memo: Write a post!

content
â”œâ”€â”€ __about
â””â”€â”€ blog
  • You can register your resume on the web. (in __about directory)
  • You can register your post. (in blog directory)

ğŸ§ Customize!

Gatsby config

/root
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-browser.js // font, polyfill, onClientRender ...
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-config.js // Gatsby config
â”œâ”€â”€ gatsby-meta-config.js // Template meta config
â””â”€â”€ gatsby-node.js // Gatsby Node config

Structure

src
â”œâ”€â”€ components // Just component with styling
â”œâ”€â”€ layout // home, post layout
â”œâ”€â”€ pages // routing except post: /(home), /about
â”œâ”€â”€ styles
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ code.scss
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ dark-theme.scss
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ light-theme.scss
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ variables.scss
â””â”€â”€ templates
    â”œâ”€â”€ blog-post.js
    â””â”€â”€ home.js

Style

You can customize color in src/styles directory.

src/styles
â”œâ”€â”€ code.scss

Welcome to gatsby-starter-bee! Happy blogging! ğŸ‘»

item.title: Welcome Bee starter
item.description: Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog! 1. Support Four frontmatter title date category draft 2. Code highlightingâ€¦
item.content:encoded:
Welcome, Gatsby! This starter is full-package for your new blog!

1. Support Four frontmatter

---
title: 'Welcome Bee starter'
date: 2019-2-6 16:21:13
category: 'development'
draft: false
---
  1. title
  2. date
  3. category
  4. draft

2. Code highlighting

  1. With Fira Code font
  2. Support highlighting with prism 2-1. Use inline highlighting
import React from 'react'

const TEMPLATE = 'gatsby-starter-bee'
class Foo extends React.Component {
  handleClick = val => {
    if (val === 'bar') {
      return 1
    } else if (val !== 'zoo') {
      return 2
    }
    console.log(`clicked`)
    return 3
  }

  render() {
    return <div>Welcome, Gatsby, ${TEMPLATE}</div>
  }
}

code

3. Support Markdown (h2)

  1. With Noto Sans font
  2. Support header anchoring

h3

h4

h5

quote!

bold italic

4. Support emoji ğŸš€

Based on emojione ğŸ™

5. Support light/dark mode

6. Support social sharing feature

  1. Twitter
  2. Facebook

Bonus, Buy me a coffee button

Set, buyMeACoffeeId of gatsby-meta-config.js

7. Comments feature

You can add comments feature by selecting one of them.

  • Disqus
  • utterances

8. Support latex

Support latex rendering with katex plugin.

$$\prod_{i=a}^{b} f(i)$$

âˆi=abf(i)\prod_{i=a}^{b} f(i)âˆi=abâ€‹f(i)

9. Other features of this template

  1. You can add resume to /about
  2. Lazy rendering
  3. Scroll restoration
  4. Categorize posts
  5. Offline caching with service worker (based gatsby)
  6. Support GA(Google Analytics)

Letâ€™s Start! Go
